data.name: Amidst Scents and Serenity
data.description: An elegant and serene garden that utilizes gazebos drawn from Razan Garden and Pardis Dhyai. This place is less concerned with the absolute unity of the disparate architectural styles, but is more focused on creating an overall air of tranquility.\nThe lovely blossoms slumber here in peace, and the standing lamps set the fountain aglow... Once the night hours approach, a walk through this garden can cause the noisy thoughts in your head to dissipate like wispy clouds. Perhaps you might even gain inspiration that you would normally struggle to find...

text.text: I see, so you've combined all your favorite sights from your travels into one.
Like picking all your favorite candies out from a huge pile, and building your dream house with them.
Um, do you mind if I come in from the chimney, just to take a look?
This style is one of the most widely used in Sumeru. You can see its influence on many of the Akademiya's buildings.
If I could recommend only one of Sumeru's architecture styles, this one would be it. The central, white section really brings the whole composition together.
As for any shortcomings... I suppose the sections extending from the floral vault are prone to collecting dust? It must be a pain to clean them.
These two trees look insanely sturdy! The foliage is also surprisingly dense.
Just imagine... how cozy would it be if we could climb up there and take a nap?
The subtle breeze blowing on the leaves, coupled with the sound of water coming from the fountain... Ahâ€” I swear, I'm feeling sleepy already...
